post.body: Ciao ZeroMe!
Hi! This is my first message on ZeroMe!
this is my desktop
What do you think about Arya Linux?
Hi guys! Wich browser do you use to enter on ZeroNet? Personally, I use a custom version of Chromium
There is a need for a return to individualism and classical liberalism
Wise words....
Nobody on ZeroMe that like italian rap??? (like Fabri Fibra, Noyz Narcos, Jesto....)

#OMG!!!
I just _noticed_ that i **can** use ```markdown``` syntax!!! **Too cool!**

New avatar!
Anyone remember Invader Zim?

Hi! I've just started new ZeroBlog (in italian) . 
**Follow please!**
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DSssmYzZvLgP4UCnLxmBXgt73TPy3JtD8/

It's called RVRE and is a really nice search engine
Hey programmers! Which is your favorite scripting / programming language? My is favorite is Bash for scripting and C for programming
Hey, have you already seen this??http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.Mkg20001.bit/ It's called ZeroMe Reloaded and is a version of ZeroMe whit a different UI and more feature
There is also an awesome settings page

# Devuan
Have you ever tried Devuan? It's a Debian derivated but whitout Systemd . It's not bad, I use it on a old netbook

# Markup Language
Hi everyone! Which is your favorite markup language? My is HTML and Markdown. I've tried also LaTEX and reStructuredText (_rst_), but I didn't like them.

# LGBT vs Islamophobia

LGBT **hates** islamophobic
islamic fundamentalist **hates** LGBT
and islamophobic **hates** islamic fundamentalist (they also hate other Islamists)

_Paradoxal but true_

# Political test 
Hi guys! Sorry for no post in these days, but I was very busy. Have you ever tried this test https://8values.github.io/ ? It's for individuate your political ideology . It's cool and enough accurate. 
In facts, I am a supporter of the **classical liberalism** .
Post your results!

# GULP!
computer entry test tomorrow
_give me your whishes!_

# Best cartoons
Hi guys! Which are your favourites 5 cartoons (**not anime**)? 
My is:
1) Rick And Morty
2) Bojack Horseman 
3) American Dad
4) Invader Zim
5) Gravity Falls

# Piratebox
Hi guys! Have you ever tried PirateBox ? It's an Archlinux-derivated that allows you to create an isolated LAN from the Internet or from other networks where it simultaneously converts the device on which it is installed on a web server and, if desired, IRC.
You can install it on a traditional router or on the Raspberry Pi. I tried it on Raspberry Pi Zero W and it did not go wrong.
Let me know what you think!

# Catalonia
So, have you heard of what happened in Catalonia?
Where are you from? What do you think about police intervention? Let me know!!

# Math
Math test tomorrow....
_Dammit!_

#Music on Zero UP

# Public money = Public software
Hi guys!
Do you know this ? https://publiccode.eu/it
Is a sign collection campaign. 
The message is very simple: 
"_Government software (write using tax) must be open source._"

**People's money, people's software.** 
Personally, I have already signed it . 


I advise you to do it too, because if it is taken into consideration, it would be a big step forward for open source software.

# Nintendo SNES ROMs
Hi guys!
Do you want some free Nintendo SNES games ? 
I've uploaded on ZeroUP a collection of 23 quite famous titles. 
Here's the link: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/17Zks611RR4oN8USC3RxJzaw94GyPufioG/Nintendo_SNES_Various_Games.zip
 
And here's the list of the games:
 
* Aladin 
* Chrono Trigger
* Donkey Kong Country 
* Earthworm Jim 
* Final Fantasy II
* Goof Troop
* Killer Instinct
* The Lion King
* Mortal Kombat (1 - 2 - 3)
* Sunset Riders
* Super Bomberman (1 - 2 - 3)
* Super Mario World
* Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in Time
* Top Gear
* Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3
* X-Men Mutant Apocalypse
* Zenkoku Jyudan Ultra Shinri Game (Japanese version)
* Zeombies Ate My Neighbors

**ENJOY!** ;)

# ZeroNet alternatives
Which is your favorite ZeroNet alternatives between: 
* IPFS
* FreeNet <-- **my favourite**
* I2P

# RetroShare 
Hi guys! 
Inspired by a comment of @=sksn= on my previous post, I've downloaded and installed **RetroShare**, a really cool P2P software. 
The only problem is that to use it you need to exchange your certificates, and I do not know anyone beyond me that you use it.
If anyone is interested in exchanging it with me (just to try it), I can contact ZeroMail (the username is " _u53r_ "). 
Thanks in advance!

# Paradiso Hentai 
Hi guys ! 
Do you like hentai? 
If the answer is "yes", visit my new site dedicated to this genre of porn: **Paradiso Hentai** ("Hentai Paradise")
http://127.0.0.1:43110/15xL5zA9TeDxdqwnikSA1SfhFEzMfBxD5D/index.html

Is under construction and only in italian, but I promise that I will upload a lot of photos and, why not, some videos . 
Thanks for visiting!

_Check it out!_
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NJyPoPpL8At17T6G7A1qHVQdqZDBmXcLT/

# Debug help needed
Hi guys, 
I've a problem with my site [Paradiso Hentai](http://127.0.0.1:43110/15xL5zA9TeDxdqwnikSA1SfhFEzMfBxD5D/) . 
I've tried lot of times to add external css, putting css documents in the site directory and including with ```<link href="http://127.0.0.1:43110/15xL5zA9TeDxdqwnikSA1SfhFEzMfBxD5D/master.css" rel="stylesheet" > ``` where ```master.css``` is the name of one of my css documents (I use this method 'cause link css with relative path's doesn't work on the pages in the subdirectory, and ```/uimedia/master.css``` works only on my machine ) . On my localhot it wors fine, but if I try to access my site from a virtual machine or another host, css doesn't work. If anyone more expert than me in ZeroNet web developing wants to help me, the help is well accepted :D . Please contact me via [ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/) . 
_Thanks!_

comment.body: @Lentsius: This is a Fabri Fibra's song: https://youtu.be/0PrdA2gLaOc , this is a Noyz Narcos' song: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRn4TvGW4TE , and this is a Jesto's song (it's really funny XD): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gO83C6TExVM

@Lentsius: If I can advise you, this of Noyz Narcos
is not bad https://youtu.be/m9UrTrkki7M
@Varya: At strictly technical level, I prefer Systemd; but use Debian + SysVinit it's cool because it's like a travel in the past
@Lentsius: It seems, but I did not know Peeper.bit when I posted this. It could be Peeper.bit a Zero Me clone charged as far as I know

@Kerfuffle: I had already programmed in Python, but I never tried Scheme.
I think I'll write something with this language out these days
@Padtrique: This links could help you: FAQ:https://piratebox.cc/faq Piratebox on Raspberry Pi:https://piratebox.cc/raspberry_pi:diy Openwrt2PirateBox:https://piratebox.cc/openwrt:diy

@ulrichard: Example of a case where PirateBox returns useful:
You have a secret meeting with someone in a bar, and you do not want to make any suspicions talking to you.
Install, PirateBox on a battery powered Raspberry Pi Zero, and configure it to create a hidden network protected by WPA2.
You first give yourself the SSID and password first, then connect and chat, exchange files or anything more securely than through any system that uses the Internet, even with excellent encryption.

This is a special case, but it is possible.
@Roninx: Are you islamophobe, LGBT or islamic fundamentalist?
@猫叉酱: I load perfectly, anyway thanks for pointing me this site (advertising never hurts ....)
So, why you not even kill yourself ?
@Nekololi: This is good for pages in ```data/15xL5zA9TeDxdqwnikSA1SfhFEzMfBxD5D``` but not for pages in subdirectory, where I can't use relative link .
